document_title: Pulmonary valve stenosis: Causes, signs and treatments
subsection_name: hep-van-dong-mach-phoi.json_5_Treatment methods for pulmonary artery stenosis
subsection_content:
The doctor will base on the clinical examination and results obtained from paraclinical tests to provide a treatment regimen. The disease is in a mild stage, with no specific symptoms and often requires no medical intervention. But if you have “visits” of chest pain, shortness of breath, or fainting spells, your pulmonary valve stenosis is progressing and needs treatment. (4)
Your doctor may prescribe medication to help blood circulate more easily. These are drugs that have the following effects:
Improve blood flow;; Thins the blood to reduce blood clotting;; Reduces excess fluid in the blood;; Prevent irregular heartbeat
Along with medication, your doctor may prescribe plastic surgery to stretch the pulmonary valve wall to improve blood flow. In severe cases, the patient may need to have the pulmonary valve replaced. The doctor will consider replacing the damaged valve with a mechanical valve or biological valve.
